business.headline: Markets bleed on Budget day: 3 reasons why Sensex fell 1,500 points todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1,546.84 points to close at 80,722.94, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 495.20 points to end at 24,825.45.

Buybacks to be taxed as capital gains: Who gains and who loses?Budget 2026 puts buybacks back in the spotlight, reshaping how India Inc returns cash and how investors respond. But in this new regime, who truly gains and who loses?

Deadline for filing revised IT returns extended to March 31 from Dec 31The time limit for filing revised income tax returns has been extended to March 31 from December 31, on payment of a nominal fee, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed on Sunday while presenting the Union Budget 2026.

What is the Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund announced in Budget 2026?Taken together, the Infrastructure Risk Guarantee Fund, higher capital spending and focus on smaller cities point to a more execution-driven approach to infrastructure development.

Budget 2026: International travel to get cheaper as tour package tax cut to 2%Tabling her ninth consecutive Budget in Lok Sabha, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman proposed a steep cut in tax collection at source (TCS) on overseas tour packages from the current 5 and 20 per cent to just 2%

Buddhist circuit in Northeast, 15 new heritage sites: Budget bets big on tourismFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced major tourism initiatives in Budget 2026 to drive growth and employment. Proposals include heritage site development, eco-trails, and medical tourism hubs, aiming to transform tourism into a key economic pillar.

From classrooms to content: Budget 2026's big push for creator economyFrom schools and colleges to social media platforms, content creation is getting policy backing. Budget 2026 outlines steps to support creators, local languages and creative skills at an early stage.

Budget: Overseas residents, foreigners can now invest directly in Indian stocksKey non-resident investment measures announced in Budget 2026 include raising the individual investment limit for Persons Resident Outside India (PROIs) from 5 per cent to 10 per cent and increasing the aggregate investment cap for all PROIs from 10 per cent to 24 per cent.

Big infra, AI data centres boost, massive defence hike, cheaper cancer drugsInfra, tech and manufacturing take the spotlight, but the market reaction adds a twist. Read on for a clearer view of what stood out in Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2026 presentation.

What is tax holiday? Budget offers 2047 break to foreign cloud firmsFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has announced a tax holiday until 2047 for foreign cloud service companies using Indian data centres, aiming to boost investment and digital infrastructure.

Silver tumbles 9%, sheds nearly Rs 27,000: Time to buy, hold or sell?Silver prices saw a sharp reversal, sliding 9% and losing close to Rs 27,000 in a single day. The sudden fall has left investors weighing a key question, is this a buying opportunity, or a sign to stay cautious?

Silent in Budget speech, defence gets big firepower amid Pak, China threatDefence Budget 2026: The massive defence allocation signals the Modi government's continued focus on military readiness and modernisation amid twin threats from Pakistan and China, especially after the brief conflict with Islamabad last year.

F&O trading to get expensive. What does it mean for investors?In the Budget, the government proposed an increase in the Securities Transaction Tax on several derivatives products. The Securities Transaction Tax on options premium has been raised from 0.1% to 0.15%.

Budget 2026: Changes to tax assessment, penalties - What it means for you?The finance minister proposed the integration of assessment and penalty proceedings into a single, common order. This means taxpayers will no longer receive separate orders for assessment and penalties, which often prolong disputes.

AI tool to help farmers cut risks: Sitharaman unveils Bharat Vistaar in Budget 2026Through Bharat Vistaar, farmers will have direct access to Kisan Call Centre services, real-time weather forecasts via APIs, and a streamlined process to learn about, apply for, and track government schemes.
Sensex crashes 1,000 points: Why is stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 1,348.50 points to 80,921.73, while the NSE Nifty50 crashed 494.35 points to 24,826.30 as of 12:34 PM.

Budget 2026: What gets cheaper and costlier for you?Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman, presenting her ninth Budget, introduced significant changes in customs duties that would impact both consumers and industries across India. Here's a look at what gets cheaper for the aam aadmi.

Tax holiday till 2047 for foreign cloud firms using Indian data centres: Budget 2026Union Budget 2026: The Centre proposed a tax holiday till 2047 for foreign cloud firms using Indian data centres to boost digital infrastructure and position India as a global hub.

Budget 2026 rolls out SHE-Marts in boost to women-owned enterprisesFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced community-owned Self-Help Entrepreneur (SHE) Marts in the Union Budget 2026, following the success of the government's flagship Lakhpati Didi scheme aimed at promoting women-led enterprises.

Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman sets stage for major foreign investment rule reformThe government is looking to update India's foreign exchange framework to reflect a more open, growth-oriented approach that matches the country's ambitions for the next decade.

entertainment.headline: Scenes from a Situationship: Vaibhav Munjal film offers a fresh take on modern love Vaibhav Munjal's directorial debut presents 'Scenes from a Situationship', a candid look at contemporary relationships. It captures the complexities and contradictions experienced by young urban couples.

D55: Sreeleela to star opposite Dhanush in Rajkumar Periasamy film The makers of the tentatively titled 'D55' have announced that Sreeleela has been roped in to star opposite Dhanush in director Rajkumar Periasamy's next film.

Rashmika-Vijay to marry in Udaipur as per viral video claim? Here's the truth A viral video by a vlogger claimed that Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to marry on February 2. However, no official confirmation is there from the two actors.

Govinda meets Yogi Adityanath, calls it a divine moment. See pic Actor Govinda visited UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow during a period of personal scrutiny, sharing a moment he called 'divine'.

Anurag Kashyap calls Dhurandhar a courageous film, dismisses propaganda claims Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap has expressed admiration for the blockbuster 'Dhurandhar', describing it as a courageous mainstream release, while also clarifying his position regarding the film's political stance.

Border 2 box office Day 9: Sunny's film set to rule 2026, crosses Rs 250 crore mark Sunny Deol's war film 'Border 2' surpassed Rs 250 crore at the box office within nine days of release. The film outperformed expectations and held steady against the debut of 'Mardaani 3'.

Mardaani 3 box office Day 2: Rani Mukerji's cop drama stays strong vs Border 2 Rani Mukerji's action thriller 'Mardaani 3' has achieved robust box office numbers in its first two days, holding its own despite competition from 'Border 2' and surpassing the opening collections of earlier films in the franchise.

Ram Charan and Upasana welcome twins, Chiranjeevi shares joyful update with fans Actor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have welcomed twins, a boy and a girl. Chiranjeevi Konidela shared the news on social media.

Copy, borrow, rehash: Why can't desi reality TV create a uniquely Indian show? Reality TV in India is all about franchised foreign shows being rehashed in Hindi or local languages. It's time our production houses tried creating truly Indian concepts.

Akshaye Khanna grooves to Chaiyya Chaiyya in old clip, fans can't keep calm Akshaye Khanna's old video grooving to Chaiyya Chaiyya has emerged online. Fans reacted to the video and expressed their love for the actor.

Kennedy: Anurag Kashyap's film set for OTT release after world premiere at Cannes The neo-noir thriller 'Kennedy' directed by Anurag Kashyap and starring Rahul Bhat and Sunny Leone, will premiere on ZEE5 on February 20, 2026. The film had its world premiere at the Cannes Film Festival in 2023.

Explained: How Dhurandhar led Flipperachi's FA9LA to a Guinness World Record Bahraini rapper Flipperachi's 2024 track 'FA9LA' secured a Guinness World Record following its inclusion in Aditya Dhar's 2025 film 'Dhurandhar'. This new honour has sparked international acclaim and renewed popularity despite the film's ban in Gulf nations.

Kichcha Sudeep marks 30 years in cinema, promises to work even harder Kannada star Kichcha Sudeep marked 30 years in the industry with a heartfelt message expressing thanks to fans, collaborators, and the Kannada film fraternity for their support and inspiration throughout his career.

I loved it: Akshay Kumar praises 'goddess of acting' Rani Mukerji in Mardaani 3 Akshay Kumar has voiced his support for Rani Mukerji and her latest film, 'Mardaani 3', through a social media post. His support comes as the film is experiencing increasing popularity at the box office across India.

Salman Khan on Battle of Galwan trolling: It's a Colonel's look, not a romantic one Salman Khan responded to the social media trolling over his look in Battle of Galwan teaser. The film is directed by Apoorva Lahia and also features Chitrangda Singh.

Kalpana Iyer reacts to viral Ramba Ho video, thanks Dhurandhar team for reviving it In an interview with India Today, veteran actor Kalpana Iyer spoke about her viral dance at a wedding. The actor expressed joy and gratitude about receiving so much love.

Valentine's special: Salman Khan's Tere Naam to re-release in theatres The 2003 romantic drama 'Tere Naam', starring Salman Khan, will return to theatres in India with a special re-release on February 27, 2026.

Border 2: Sunny Deol grooves, cuts cake amid film's roaring success. Watch Sunny Deol and the cast of Border 2* celebrate the film's success as it achieves record-breaking earnings just days after its Republic Day release.

Amaal Mallik backs AR Rahman's stance on industry bias but disagrees on communalism Amaal Mallik reacted to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in the Hindi film industry. He emphasised that Rahman was trying to highlight a larger issue.

general news.headline: AUS Open Live:Alcaraz leads 4–2 in third set vs Djokovic amid roof controversyAustralian Open men's singles Live: Carlos Alcaraz has taken a 4–2 lead in the third set after levelling the match with a 6–2 win in the second. Earlier, Novak Djokovic had completely dictated proceedings, producing a masterclass to sweep aside the world No. 1 6–2 in a one-sided opening set.

India slams Pak's Balochistan remark: Deflecting attention from internal failingsIndia rejected Pakistan's allegations linking it to violence in Balochistan as baseless, accusing Islamabad of deflecting attention from its own internal issues, the MEA said.

The Honest Budget: Higher transaction tax to prevent gambling-like investmentsWe will begin with honesty here. We aren't economists, we are just a couple of citizens who will be affected by Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget like you. Also, the Budget and economy needn't be drab. So, we will be trying to make sense of terms and jargons before explaining them here. We will share jokes and memes with you on this blog too. So, let's Budget in some fun.

High-speed rails, rare earths corridors, AI data centres: Which state got whatBudget 2026 unveils major projects for states including West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Assam, Uttar Pradesh, and more. Here's a state-wise look.

Europe will drink Assam's tea: Amit Shah uses India-EU FTA as poll plankUnion Home Minister Amit Shah, speaking at a rally in Dibrugarh, said that Assam's tea will be poured into every European cup after the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with the European Union. The deal would bring zero tariffs on tea leaves, Shah said. Here's how the FTA has emerged as a key poll plank in the election-bound state.

Budget support to Bangladesh halved amid strained tiesBangladesh faces one of the steepest cuts in India's foreign aid, with its allocation reduced from Rs 120 crore to Rs 60 crore, even as assistance to most other neighbouring countries has been maintained or increased.

Balance of power is...: Elon Musk as IMF puts India ahead of US in global growthElon Musk said the 'balance of power is changing,' highlighting an eastward shift in the global economy amid trade tensions and moderating inflation trends.

Who is Peter Steinberger and why will you hear a lot about him and MoltbookA former iOS developer has become the latest sensation in the tech community. He is Peter Steinberger and he is the man behind Clawdbot, now called OpenClaw, that has led to creation of Moltbook, a social media site where AI bots can hangout.

How Dilan Teer Bija from Pak's Lyari became a hit at Indian weddingsA Balochi song, Dilan Teer Bija, has been a must-play at shaadis in India's Hyderabad for years. Dilan Teer Bija was a political song of Benazir Bhutto's time from Karachi's Lyari, the canvas of Dhurandhar. But how did a PPP song become a staple in marriages in India? This Sunday Special reveals the unusual journey of music across borders.

Khamenei's big 'regional war' warning as Trump tight-lipped on Iran actionIran's supreme leader warns any US attack will spark a regional war in the Middle East. The declaration follows US naval deployment and Iran's designation of EU militaries as terrorist groups, escalating tensions.

Praful Patel rejects reports of being named NCP chief after Ajit Pawar's deathThe Nationalist Congress Party faces uncertainty over its leadership following Ajit Pawar's sudden demise, with working president Praful Patel denying reports of his elevation to party president.

PM calls Budget 2026 futuristic, says India not content with fastest-growing tagPrime Minister Narendra Modi hailed Union Budget 2026 as a historic and future-oriented plan that empowers women and accelerates India's journey to become the world's third-largest economy.

The bag, the Brit, and the bahi-khata: A biography of the BudgetIndia's budgetary story began under colonial rule. On April 7, 1860, James Wilson, a Scottish economist and founder of The Economist, presented the first Indian budget. On November 26, 1947, RK Shanmukham Chetty presented independent India's first budget to the Constituent Assembly.

Budget 2026 puts cancer care, mental health at the centre of India's health agendaThe Union Budget marks a shift in health priorities, placing cancer care and mental health at the centre. With a push for affordable cancer drugs and stronger mental health infrastructure, healthcare is framed as long-term national capacity. 
The emphasis is on building systems, not just treating disease.

3 new All India Institutes of Ayurveda, AYUSH pharmacies upgradeThe Budget proposed three new All India Institutes of Ayurveda and upgrades Ayush pharmacies and drug testing labs to improve certification standards, medicine quality and availability, and expand skilled manpower nationwide.

Budget 2026-27: List of 17 cancer drugs exempted from customs dutyIn a major relief for cancer patients, the Union Budget 2026-27 has exempted basic customs duty on 17 life-saving drugs. The move aims to make advanced cancer treatment more affordable and accessible in India.

Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Buddhist circuit in Northeast, 15 new heritage sites: Budget bets big on tourismFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced major tourism initiatives in Budget 2026 to drive growth and employment. Proposals include heritage site development, eco-trails, and medical tourism hubs, aiming to transform tourism into a key economic pillar.

India's climate fight gets bare minimum push amid rising extreme eventsWhile the hike appears significant on paper, the absolute size of the allocation remains small given the scale of India's climate and ecological challenges.

Ram Charan and Upasana welcome twins, Chiranjeevi shares joyful update with fansActor Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela have welcomed twins, a boy and a girl. Chiranjeevi Konidela shared the news on social media.

1000s of AI bots gather at bot-only site, talk of their consciousnessMany people are currently using an AI system called Moltbot — actually renamed to OpenClaw. It lets people run almost autonomous AI. Now, these bots have discovered they can gather together on the web and talk about bot stuff privately. They are talking of stuff that will come across as a nightmare to humans.

Budget: Content creators' labs in 15,000 schools, girls' hostel in every districtDuring her Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the setting up of one girls' hostel in every district of the country. There are over 700 districts in the country.

They are coming in: Trump claims India will buy Venezuelan oil, not Iran crudeThe United States is encouraging India to consider Venezuelan oil as a replacement for Russian imports, part of Washington's broader effort to limit funds flowing to Moscow amid its war in Ukraine.

sports.headline: Let off twice, but Vaibhav Suryavanshi fails to cash in; another failure vs Pak U19 World Cup 2026: Vaibhav Suryavanshi struggled to again make an impact against Pakistan, scoring 30 off 22 balls before Mohammad Sayyam accounted for his wicket in the Super 6 match in Bulawayo.

Union Budget 2026: Government proposes Khelo India mission to transform sports The government on Sunday proposed the launch of a Khelo India mission aimed at strengthening India's sports ecosystem over the next decade, expanding the scope of the existing programme beyond talent identification to include systemic development of infrastructure, coaching and support systems.

No T20 World Cup, no problem. Bangladesh rolls out their own domestic T20 Cup Following the ICC's decision to replace Bangladesh with Scotland for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026, the Bangladesh Cricket Board has moved swiftly to address the gap, announcing the launch of a new domestic tournament—the ODOMMO Bangladesh T20 Cup 2026.

IND vs PAK, Live: Abhigyan Kundu departs for 16 IND vs PAK, U-19 World Cup Live Score: Ahmed Hussain has taken the big wicket of Vihaan Malhotra to break the big partnership. Abhigyan Kundu has joined Vedant Trivedi in the middle.

AUS Open Live: Alcaraz makes it 2-2 in 3rd set vs Djokovic after roof controversy Australian Open men's singles Live: Carlos Alcaraz looks frustrated as he complains to chair umpire John Blom, perhaps over the roof after winning the second set. Earlier, Novak Djokovic had completely dictated proceedings, producing a masterclass to sweep aside the world No. 1 6-2 in a one-sided opening set.

Ishan Kishan grabs the Tatkal ticket. Is Sanju Samson back on the waiting list? Has one dominant T20I series reshaped India's batting hierarchy? Ishan Kishan's surge has brought urgency and clarity, while Sanju Samson's struggles have reopened familiar questions on the eve of a T20 World Cup title defence.

If Abhishek doesn't get you, Ishan will: NZ skipper Santner on India's Trivandrum show Ishan Kishan's Thiruvananthapuram hundred left New Zealand out of options, forcing Mitchell Santner to put his hands up. With the T20 World Cup days away, India's batting firepower is peaking at the right time.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Melbourne Park braces for ultimate Difficult vs Impossible clash Australian Open: Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are all set for a blockbuster final at Melbourne Park on Sunday. While Djokovic is looking for his 25th Grand Slam title, Alcaraz is one win away from a Career Slam.

Watch: Chelsea vs West Ham thriller ends in ugly brawl as Todibo strangles Joao Pedro Chelsea completed a stunning 3–2 comeback against West Ham at Stamford Bridge, but victory was eclipsed by chaos. A stoppage-time brawl ended with Todibo sent off for throttling Joao Pedro, turning a thriller into flashpoint.

The Jemimah Rodrigues struggle: Why the Delhi captain is faltering in close matches WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues has endured a mixed season as captain, with Delhi Capitals on the brink of an early exit from the tournament. The challenges have been compounded by her struggles with the bat, making it a testing campaign both as a leader and as a batter.

Alcaraz vs Djokovic live streaming: When and where to watch Australian Open final Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz meet in the Australian Open men's singles final. The match could redefine tennis history with records and legacies on the line.

IND vs NZ: Why did Ishan Kishan keep in place of Samson? Suryakumar Yadav explainsIshan Kishan took over wicketkeeping duties and scored his maiden T20I hundred in the fifth match against New Zealand. This planned rotation strategy boosts India's preparation and confidence ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Kishan not satisfied with New Zealand comeback, sets sights on World Cup gloryIshan Kishan scored a stunning century in the final T20I against New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. He remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup in 2026 despite his comeback success.

IND vs PAK, U19 World Cup: India seek payback against Pakistan after Asia Cup routIndia U19 prepare to face Pakistan in a crucial Super Six World Cup match. The game carries added tension following a heavy Asia Cup final defeat for India.

Ishan, Arshdeep power Trivandrum rout as India firm T20 World Cup favourites tagIND vs NZ, 5th T20I: Led by Ishan Kishan's brutal maiden century and a clinical maiden five-wicket haul from Arshdeep Singh, India dismantled New Zealand in Thiruvananthapuram. Despite a heavy evening dew, a record-breaking 271 proved insurmountable, as the Men in Blue emphatically reinforced their status as the side to beat at the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Usman Tariq's bowling under scanner? Cameron Green fumes after his dismissal: WatchCameron Green questioned Usman Tariq's bowling action after his dismissal in the second T20I between Pakistan and Australia. Pakistan dominated the match to seal a 2-0 series lead amid growing debate over the spinner's legality.
South Africa vs West Indies 3rd T20I: Live score and updates from JohannesburgSouth Africa vs West Indies, 3rd T20I Live Score: South Africa have won the toss and chose to bowl first.

WPL 2026 Qualification Scenario: How MI, DC and UP Warriorz can qualify for EliminatorWPL 2026: Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, and UP Warriorz are still in the race for the Eliminator, with only one league match remaining on February 1 between the Capitals and the Warriorz.

In Sanju Samson's hometown, Ishan Kishan makes statement with 42-ball hundredIND vs NZ: Ishan Kishan scored his spectacular maiden T20I century against New Zealand during the fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. He smashed six fours and ten sixes in his innings to help India post 271/5 in their 20 overs.

Fiery Suryakumar Yadav sends T20 World Cup warning with historic T20I recordIND vs N: Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 3,000 runs in men's T20Is, achieving the feat in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand in Trivandrum.

Sanju Samson's horror run continues, batter disappoints local crowd in TrivandrumIND vs NZ: Sanju Samson failed to impress at his home ground during the fifth T20I against New Zealand. The opening batter was dismissed for 6, leaving his large fanbase disappointed.

International Olympic Committee monitors India after T20 World Cup row: ReportThe 2026 T20 World Cup disco has put India's 2036 Olympic hosting ambitions under scrutiny, with the IOC unlikely to tolerate political tensions that risk boycotts by participating nations.

Kishan, Patel return for 5th T20I as India finalise World Cup preparationIndia made three changes to their playing XI for the final T20I against New Zealand. Captain Suryakumar Yadav opted to bat first to test bowlers under dew ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Subtle over spectacle: Rybakina's calm celebration strikes a chord after winAustralian Open: Elena Rybakina marked her maiden Australian Open title at Melbourne Park with a restrained celebration, offering only a quiet fist pump. On Saturday, she defeated Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to avenge her loss in the 2023 final.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Who is Rafael Nadal supporting in AUS Open final?Australian Open: Legendary Rafael Nadal will be happy if Novak Djokovic wins the Australian Open. Speaking ahead of the 2026 final, Nadal has explained what impresses him the most about Djokovic.

Giant-sized cut-out, fan from Qatar: Trivandrum turns up for Sanju SamsonIndia vs New Zealand: A festival-like mood engulfed Thiruvananthapuram as a Rs 1.2 lakh giant cut-out, drummers and devoted fans, including one from Qatar, celebrated Sanju Samson's long-awaited homecoming.

Elena Rybakina gets sweet revenge over Aryna Sabalenka, lifts Australian Open crownAustralian Open 2026: Elena Rybakina won her maiden title at Melbourne Park after beating World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter on Saturday at the Rod Laver Arena. Sabalenka, meanwhile, lost back-to-back finals at Melbourne Park.

5th T20I Highlights: Arshdeep's 5-wicket haul sets up 46-run win for IndiaIndia vs New Zealand, 5th T20I Highlights: India beat New Zealand by 46 runs in the final T20I in Thiruvananthapuram to complete a 4-1 series win. Arshdeep Singh starred with his maiden five-wicket haul, while Axar Patel also scalped three wickets. Finn Allen was the lone warrior for New Zealand with his brilliant innings of 80 (38).

Tilak Varma's last bid push for T20 World Cup, trains intensely with Mayank YadavTilak Varma has been training hard to be fully fit for the T20 World Cup after he missed the five-match T20I series against New Zealand. Tilak last played for India in the South Africa T20Is after which he played two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches.

India need to stick with Gautam Gambhir, split coaching confuses players: BavumaSplit coaching is not going to solve India's ongoing Test crisis, feels South Africa's Temba Bavuma. Bavuma believes that removing Gambhir from the Test job and giving it to someone else is not going to help the Indian team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
